actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to make it clear that the monthly earnings test (under the amendment made by section 303 of the Social Security Amendments of 1977) is available to every beneficiary in at least one year after 1977.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that no part of the excess earnings of an individual shall be charged to any month if such month is in the taxable year in which occurs the first month after December 1977 that is both a month in which the individual is entitled to benefits and is unemployed.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to make it clear that the monthly earnings test (under the amendment made by section 303 of the Social Security Amendments of 1977) is available to every beneficiary in at least one year after 1977.
